definitions: steady devotion or support for a belief, rule, or organization
physical attachment or sticking of one substance to another
examples: Their strict adherence to safety protocols prevented workplace accidents
The company demands adherence to ethical business practices
The adherence of the label to the bottle weakened in hot weather
Scientists studied the adherence between different material surfaces

definitions: person who supports a particular party, person, or set of ideas
substance or material that sticks or adheres to something
examples: The political party gained thousands of new adherents after the debate
Religious adherents gathered for the annual pilgrimage ceremony
The medical adherent kept the bandage firmly attached to the skin
Chemists developed a stronger adherent for industrial applications

definitions: force of attraction between molecules of different substances in contact
abnormal union of body tissues due to inflammation or injury
action of giving support or allegiance to a cause or belief
examples: The adhesion between the paint and metal surface lasted for decades
Scientists measured the adhesion strength of various polymer compounds
Post-surgical adhesions caused chronic pain in the patient's abdomen
The doctor explained how abdominal adhesions could affect fertility
The country announced its adhesion to the international climate treaty
Their adhesion to democratic principles remained unwavering

definitions: substance used for sticking objects or materials together permanently
quality or property of being able to stick to surfaces
examples: The carpenter applied adhesive before joining the wooden pieces together
Industrial adhesive can bond metal to plastic surfaces
The adhesive properties of the tape made it perfect for packaging
Engineers tested the adhesive strength under extreme temperatures

definitions: goodbye or farewell, especially when parting for a long time
examples: She bid him a tearful adieu at the train station
The poet's final adieu to his homeland moved readers deeply

definitions: state or condition of being next to or adjoining something
relationship between vertices connected by an edge in graph theory
examples: The adjacency of the two properties made the merger financially attractive
Urban planners considered the adjacency of residential and commercial zones
The adjacency matrix represented connections between network nodes efficiently
Students learned to calculate adjacency relationships in graph algorithms

definitions: word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun
examples: The teacher explained how adjectives make writing more descriptive and vivid
In English, adjectives usually come before the nouns they modify

definitions: temporary suspension or postponement of a meeting, legal case, or legislative session
examples: The judge called for an adjournment until Monday morning
Parliament's adjournment allowed members to return to their constituencies

definitions: formal judgment or decision about a disputed matter, especially in law
process of judging a competition or evaluating competitive bids
examples: The adjudication of the property dispute took several months to complete
Both parties agreed to accept the court's adjudication as final
The adjudication of the music festival required three expert judges
Contract adjudication ensured the lowest qualified bidder won

definitions: person who makes a formal judgment or decision about a disputed issue
person who judges the quality of performances in a competition
examples: The adjudicator ruled in favor of the tenant after reviewing evidence
An independent adjudicator resolved the insurance claim dispute
The dance competition adjudicator provided detailed feedback to contestants
Festival adjudicators selected winners from hundreds of entries

definitions: thing added or attached to something larger or more important
teacher employed on a temporary or part-time basis at a college
examples: The research facility serves as an adjunct to the main laboratory
These exercises are useful adjuncts to classroom learning
The university hired several adjunct professors to teach evening courses
Many adjuncts work at multiple institutions to make ends meet

definitions: person who investigates and settles insurance claims professionally
mechanical device used to alter or regulate something's position
examples: The insurance adjuster assessed the storm damage to determine compensation
Claims adjusters investigated the accident before approving payment
The seat adjuster allowed drivers to find their optimal position
Technicians used a tension adjuster to calibrate the machinery

definitions: small alteration or movement made to achieve a desired result
process of adapting or becoming used to a new situation
examples: The mechanic made minor adjustments to improve engine performance
Price adjustments reflected changes in market conditions
Moving abroad required significant psychological and cultural adjustment
Children's adjustment to new schools can take several months

definitions: group of people responsible for managing an organization or government
process of organizing and managing the affairs of a business or institution
action of dispensing or applying medication or treatment to someone
examples: The university administration announced new policies for student housing
The current administration faces challenges from opposition parties
Her administration of the department improved efficiency significantly
The administration of justice requires impartiality and fairness
The nurse supervised the administration of medication to patients
Proper administration of the vaccine requires trained medical staff

definitions: person responsible for managing and organizing an institution or organization
person legally appointed to manage and distribute a deceased person's estate
examples: The hospital administrator coordinated between departments to improve patient care
School administrators met to discuss the new curriculum changes
The court appointed an administrator to handle the contested estate
Estate administrators must file tax returns for the deceased

definitions: highest ranking naval officer, typically commanding a fleet or naval forces
examples: The admiral commanded the Pacific fleet during wartime operations
She became the first female admiral in the nation's naval history

definitions: government department or officials formerly responsible for the navy
branch of law relating to maritime affairs and naval matters
examples: The admiralty issued new regulations for merchant vessel safety
Historical admiralty records revealed details of naval expeditions
Admiralty law governs disputes involving ships and maritime commerce
The case fell under admiralty jurisdiction due to international waters

definitions: feeling of respect and warm approval for someone or something's qualities
examples: Her admiration for the artist's work inspired her own paintings
The team earned admiration for their perseverance despite setbacks

definitions: person who regards someone or something with respect or approval
person who has romantic feelings or attraction toward someone
examples: The author had many admirers who appreciated her unique writing style
Art admirers gathered at the gallery opening to view new works
She received flowers from a secret admirer on Valentine's Day
Her admirers competed for her attention at social events

definitions: quality of being acceptable or valid, especially as evidence in court proceedings
examples: The judge ruled on the admissibility of the witness testimony
Defense lawyers challenged the admissibility of illegally obtained evidence

definitions: process or fact of entering or being allowed to enter a place or organization
statement acknowledging the truth of something, typically reluctant
examples: College admission requirements include standardized test scores and essays
The museum charges no admission fee on Sunday afternoons
His admission of guilt led to a reduced sentence
The CEO's admission of mistakes helped restore public trust

definitions: permission or right to enter a place or join an organization
measure of how easily alternating current flows through a circuit
examples: Security guards controlled admittance to the exclusive event
The sign clearly stated no admittance without proper identification
Engineers calculated the admittance to optimize circuit performance
The admittance value helped determine the system's electrical efficiency

definitions: substance formed by mixing other substances together without chemical change
something mixed with something else, typically as a minor ingredient
examples: The concrete admixture improved the material's strength and durability
Genetic analysis revealed an admixture of different ancestral populations
The story contained an admixture of fact and fiction
Her personality showed an interesting admixture of boldness and caution

definitions: firm warning or reprimand about someone's behavior or actions
examples: The judge's admonition about courtroom behavior silenced the gallery
Parents delivered stern admonitions about the dangers of reckless driving

definitions: unnecessary activity or ceremony, especially about something unimportant
examples: They married quietly without much ado or celebration
The committee made much ado about minor procedural issues

definitions: sun-dried brick made from clay and straw used in construction
building constructed from adobe bricks, common in arid regions
examples: Traditional adobe bricks provided excellent insulation in desert climates
Workers mixed clay and straw to create adobe for construction
The historic adobe church has stood for over two centuries
Many adobe houses in the Southwest feature thick walls and flat roofs

definitions: transitional stage of physical and psychological development between childhood and adulthood
examples: During adolescence, teenagers experience significant hormonal and emotional changes
Her difficult adolescence shaped her understanding of youth psychology

definitions: young person in the process of developing from a child into an adult
examples: The clinic specializes in treating adolescents with eating disorders
Adolescents often struggle with identity and peer pressure issues

definitions: person who legally takes another person's child into their family
person or organization that starts using a new technology or method
examples: Prospective adopters underwent extensive background checks and home studies
The agency matched adopters with children needing permanent homes
Early adopters of smartphones gained competitive advantages in business
The company targeted technology adopters with innovative marketing campaigns

definitions: legal process of taking another person's child into one's family permanently
action of choosing to take up, follow, or use something new
examples: International adoption requires navigating complex legal procedures
The adoption process included interviews and home inspections
The rapid adoption of remote work changed corporate culture permanently
Technology adoption rates vary significantly across different age groups

definitions: deep love and respect, typically tinged with reverence
worship and honor given to a deity or sacred object
examples: Her adoration for her grandmother was evident in every gesture
The fans' adoration of the celebrity bordered on obsession
The congregation engaged in silent adoration before the altar
Medieval paintings depicted the adoration of the Magi

definitions: decorative object or detail added to something to make it more attractive
examples: The bride wore minimal adornment, preferring natural beauty
Ancient tomb adornments revealed the wealth of their occupants

definitions: hormone secreted by adrenal glands, increasing heart rate and blood pressure during stress
examples: The adrenaline rush from skydiving lasted long after landing
Doctors administered adrenaline to treat the severe allergic reaction

definitions: excessive admiration or praise, especially of a servile nature
examples: The politician basked in the adulation of his supporters
Critics warned that constant adulation could corrupt young stars

definitions: person who is fully grown or developed, legally of age
content or material intended for mature audiences only
examples: Adults must take responsibility for their financial decisions
The workshop teaches adults basic computer literacy skills
The movie received an adult rating due to violent content
Adult themes in the novel made it unsuitable for children

definitions: action of making something poorer in quality by adding inferior substances
examples: Food adulteration with harmful chemicals poses serious health risks
The adulteration of medicine led to criminal prosecution

definitions: voluntary sexual intercourse between a married person and someone other than their spouse
examples: The divorce proceedings cited adultery as grounds for separation
Many religions consider adultery a serious moral transgression

definitions: period of being fully grown and developed, typically from age eighteen onward
examples: The transition to adulthood involves increasing independence and responsibility
Many cultures mark the passage into adulthood with special ceremonies

definitions: forward movement of troops or forces in military operations
money paid before it is due or for work not yet done
development or improvement in knowledge, technology, or social conditions
examples: The general ordered an advance toward enemy positions at dawn
Allied forces halted their advance at the river crossing
Employees can request a salary advance for emergency expenses
The publisher offered a substantial advance for her next novel
Recent advances in cancer treatment have improved survival rates
Technological advances transformed communication methods globally

definitions: promotion or progression in one's career or social position
process of promoting or furthering the development of something
examples: Her advancement to senior management came after years of dedication
Career advancement opportunities attracted talented employees to the company
The foundation supports the advancement of medical research
Social advancement requires equal access to education

definitions: condition or circumstance that puts one in a favorable position over others
tennis score when a player needs one more point to win after deuce
examples: Their technological advantage helped them dominate the market
Speaking multiple languages gives job seekers a competitive advantage
After a long rally, she finally gained the advantage
The server lost the advantage with a double fault

definitions: arrival of a notable person, thing, or event marking an important change
Christian season of expectation before Christmas, beginning four Sundays before
examples: The advent of smartphones revolutionized personal communication
The advent of democracy brought hope for political reform
Churches prepare special services during the Advent season
Advent calendars help children count down to Christmas

definitions: unusual and exciting experience or activity, typically involving some danger
commercial venture or speculation involving financial risk
examples: Their adventure through the Amazon rainforest lasted three weeks
She wrote a book about her adventures traveling solo
His latest business adventure involved cryptocurrency investments
The risky adventure in real estate nearly bankrupted them

definitions: person who enjoys or seeks exciting and dangerous experiences
person who seeks success or position through unscrupulous means
examples: The adventurer documented her solo expedition to Antarctica
Famous adventurers inspired generations to explore the unknown
Political adventurers exploited the country's instability for personal gain
Financial adventurers took advantage of regulatory loopholes

definitions: word that modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, expressing manner, place, time, or degree
examples: Students learned that adverbs often end in '-ly' in English
The adverb 'quickly' describes how the action was performed

definitions: word, phrase, or clause that functions as an adverb in a sentence
examples: The adverbial phrase 'with great care' modified the main verb
Teachers explained how adverbial clauses express time, place, or manner

definitions: person, group, or force that opposes or attacks; an enemy or competitor
examples: The chess player studied her adversary's previous matches carefully
Nations must sometimes negotiate with former adversaries for peace

definitions: difficult or unpleasant situation involving hardship, misfortune, or suffering
examples: She showed remarkable strength in the face of adversity
The team's unity helped them overcome adversity and win

definitions: public notice or announcement promoting a product, service, or event
examples: The television advert featured a celebrity endorsement
Job adverts in the newspaper attracted numerous qualified candidates

definitions: public announcement or notice promoting products, services, or events through various media
examples: The advertisement campaign increased brand awareness significantly
Online advertisements targeted specific demographic groups effectively
